data.title: Bryan Gervais, Ph.D. | College of Liberal and Fine Arts
data.meta_description: Profile for Bryan Gervais, Ph.D., Director of the UTSA Center for Public Opinion Research, Political Science and Geography
data.text:
Bio

Dr. Bryan Gervais is an Associate Professor in the Department of Political Science & Geography and inaugural Director UTSA Center for Public Opinion Research (CPOR) at UTSA. His areas of specialization are political communication and political psychology.

He is the author of Reactionary Republicanism: How the Tea Party in the House Paved the Way for Trumpâ€™s Victory (Oxford University Press) with Irwin Morris. His journal publications have appeared in Political Psychology; Political Communication; PS: Political Science & Politics; Politics, Groups, and Identities; Social Science Quarterly; International Journal of Public Opinion Research; and Journal of Information Technology and Politics.

Dr. Gervais earned his Ph.D. in Government & Politics at the University of Maryland.
